Specifically for this

 ChartedSpace (EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin 1)) (EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin 1) ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin 1))

What you need is a model vector space which is a vector space. The natural model vector space for the dual vector space is just the dual vector space!

This may seem silly, but let me put this in a broader perspective. If you have vector bundles fun (x : M) ‚Üí E x and fun (x : M) ‚Üí E' x, where the base is modelled on a space B and the fiber on spaces F and F', then the vector bundles are modelled respectively on B x F and B x F'. Then we have a vector bundle of continuous linear maps, which is just fun (x : M) ‚Üí (E x ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] E' x), and the natural model space for this one is B x (F ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] F'), as it should.

Ah I was using the wrong model space leading to this message - thank you - I would have naively tried to implement such an instance - instead I have

ùìò(‚Ñù, EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin 1) ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin 1))
